text.0:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A letter shared claiming that the governor of Kenya's Mombasa County, Hassan Joho, has resigned from his position as deputy party leader of the Orange Democratic Movement is fake.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: Both Mr Joho and ODM have dismissed the letter as false: https://t.co/74bCGe1tbd
text.1:
A Facebook post with photos claiming to show the poor state of Uganda's infrastructure despite the ruling party’s 35-year leadership is MISLEADING.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The photos were taken in different African countries, and only two of them are from Uganda: https://t.co/at3HgjG5LR
text.2:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A Facebook page mimicking the branding of e-commerce retailer Jumia and offering a 50% discount on products is fake.

:money_with_wings: The page does not link to the legitimate Jumia website, and customers need to pay directly to a mobile number: https://t.co/6KTuSpjEmc
text.3:
A screenshot shared on Facebook with text claiming that the use of thermometer guns to take people’s temperature can erase their memory is SATIRE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The screenshot with the claim was posted in a satirical Facebook group called Science Humour: https://t.co/0C3fyj9Y8y
text.4:
How accurate is John Mbadi's claim that women voters outnumber men in Suba South, the constituency he represents in Kenya's Parliament?

:bar_chart: We looked at the data and found the claim to be true: https://t.co/pK3Bsa8c0p
text.5:
A video shared on Twitter claiming to show an armed security officer in :Uganda: torturing a civilian is :cross_mark: FALSE.

The video was first shared in January 2020, with text indicating it was filmed in :Malawi:: https://t.co/6nYCNYYVpv
text.6:
An image of @NationAfrica's front page showing a headline quoting Deputy President William Ruto as saying “Jubilee is an abusive marriage” is ALTERED.

:newspaper: The legitimate front page from that date carries a different story: https://t.co/orB5Q4PErv
text.7:
An article claiming that Infotrak Kenya has released an opinion poll showing the popularity of politicians from Western Kenya is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: Infotrak has distanced itself from the poll through a statement posted on its official Facebook page: https://t.co/8HWz7yE8mY
text.8:
A tweet with photos claiming to document genocide in :Congo_-_Kinshasa: is PARTLY FALSE.

:camera_with_flash: While it’s true that violence in the country has affected thousands of people, the photos are from the genocide that took place in Rwanda: https://t.co/1OPqcGRXdu
text.9:
A Facebook post with photos claiming a plane crashed in Mukono District of :Uganda: is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The crash involved the governor of Kenya's Narok County, Samuel Ole Tunai, and occurred in Melili, Narok: https://t.co/xeHGF32T6o
text.10:
A photo shared on Twitter claiming to show Kenya’s Deputy President William Ruto on the campaign trail in Meru County is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The image was taken in :Vietnam: and shows a motorcade carrying the body of army general Võ Nguyên Giáp: https://t.co/sol3Z0aqUp
